extendedInfo.description: Please contact us directly with any comments or questions. We value your input as we continue to improve your overall experience with MaaS360.  Contact us: http://www.maas360.com/about/contact-us/.MaaS360 Mobile Device Management for Android Devices is the first cloud-based MDM solution that supports Android devices.Key features include:> Visibility â View hardware and software inventory, network details, and security status> Control â Enforce passcode policies, restrict device features and applications> Security â Lock, locate and wipe devices, and reset passcodes> Resilience â If a user opts out, MaaS360 alerts the Administrator so that IT can take appropriate action> Dashboards â Graphical reports highlight key real-time compliance metrics as well as asset and network details> My Watch List Alerts â Point out potential problems and other key details> Support for corporate and personal devices â Users enroll themselves, and approved policies are distributed automaticallyFor more details, visit http://maas360.com/.Note: To activate Fiberlink's MaaS360 Mobile Device Management for Android Devices, you must have an enterprise account with MaaS360. If you do not, ask your IT department to contact us at http://www.maas360.com/about/contact-us/.

reviews.title: Update fails
reviews.comment: This is not only a memory hog. But once installed and configured it will no longer accept the updates.
reviews.author: Tim Roberts

reviews.title: Invasion Of Privacy via Corporate Blackmail
reviews.comment: Allows company\'s IT to spy on workers and uses access to corporate e-mail or apps as a kind of blackmail.  Total invasion of privacy.  Has HUGE flaw.  If you change your password after the initial setup on the device, you will be blocked from connecting to E-mail and must call your company IT personnel.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Kills Performance
reviews.comment: Since installing this app on my Droid RAZR MAXX my phone runs terrible and the mobile hotspot does not work. Removed the app and everything worked fine again. Had to reinstall it for work but about to just say forget it and remove company access. It is not worth the frustration of having my phone crippled. The app also ate up disk space. Said it was only 40mb in apps but after deleting it, it freed up nearly 500mb. The benefits do not outweigh the problems in this case...
reviews.author: Tim Howell

reviews.title: Works as Advertised
reviews.comment: It works the way it is advertised.  I have seen a lot of people complaining about how it removes a lot of abilities of the phone.  By default, this app doesn\'t remove any ability from the device.  The IT department managing it removes the functionality as part of their security policy.  I have not had one issue with this software on my phone and I don\'t even notice it.
reviews.author: Douglas Gawtry

reviews.title: Great....but
reviews.comment: Trying this app out. Everything is really nice but it looks like the secure email feature kills your battery. Way too many wake locks.
reviews.author: Ahron Darnell

reviews.title: No thanks
reviews.comment: It wants to erase all of my data and perform a factory reset, just for corporate email access....? No thank you, I\'ll wait for a corporate phone for that.
reviews.author: Tara Buchanan

reviews.title: Lacking
reviews.comment: I\'m going to break the myths for those who seem to be confused about this app. -- 1. The app does not allow IT to see anything personal, beyond knowing the applications installed, and in all honesty, none of us care. 2. Location data, yes, it can see, though again, 99% of companies will never use it. It\'s disabled on our account. Though the upside is that the user can track their phone in the case they lose it. Though a better tracking software is Cerberus. Look it up. 3. Yes the app can wipe your device, but so can your phone being connected to 99% of corporate servers. It\'s built into exchange. MaaS gives the ability to wipe ONLY corporate email. Albeit, it only works when used on Motos and newer Samsungs. 4. Battery life can range depending on the settings the IT dept sets. Ours are set to sync every 4 hours. Default is 15 minutes.  Bottom line people. Don\'t assume because you don\'t understand.  As for dev: Ideally, the things that would make this better. 1. Push ability to get rid of the polling battery drain. 2. Less complicated for EU\'s. 3. Support auto email and selective wipe on all major devices, Moto, HTC and Samsung. At current, selective isn\'t supported on HTC.
reviews.author: Joseph Greenbaum

reviews.title: Forced to install
reviews.comment: Had to install this for work.
reviews.author: Adam Noxeor

reviews.title: Notification bar
reviews.comment: Please remove your app logo in tge notification bar, we have NO need to go into that program, please remove!!!   Will update rating after it is fixed
reviews.author: Dashon Branigan

reviews.title: Awesome Support
reviews.comment: We just implemented Maas360 for our company, and their tech support was outsanding.  The account executive and the help desk along with a system engineer went over and above.  After working with the help desk late into the night, I emailed my account executive at 11pm on a Friday.  I received a response on Saturday and again on Sunday.  I had requested system engineer help.  Monday morning by 9am I had a scheduled time for a webex and spent almost 3 hours trying to resolve out problems.  The resolution still is not in place but only because we are implementing an upgrade to our Exchange Server.
reviews.author: Butch Ford

reviews.title: Prompt response to the Notification Bar issue.
reviews.comment: Thank you MaaS360 for resolving the Notification Area issues, version 3.42 properly removes the persistent notification.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Spiers

reviews.title: Irritating app!
reviews.comment: After my initial review, the functionality was changed within a few days. The app is now in the foreground and not visible in the notification bar any more. The app does it job, does it well and doesn\'t bug the end user. Thanks! ////(old review) -->  I do fully understand why corporates need this app. Even if it reduces the battery time somewhat, it\'s not that bad. This is not meant for the end user, it\'s meant for the admins.  But what the h*** was the product manager thinking of when forcing the app into the notification bar? As an end user - I don\'t need to see this app. There is no value what so ever for me to have the app there. I can\'t remove it, nor make any changes to the app.  If this is a business, stop bugging the end user, or they will soon see to that their company will not use this app anymore.  Thanks, m
reviews.author: Marcus Lindh
